title: Winter pressures at Dorset NHS hospitals - BBC News
summary: providing live updates from hospitals in bournemouth and poole .
winter pressures taking their toll on nhs .
current winter described as `` worst on record '' for hospitals .
dorset hospitals also preparing for huge changes .
big reconfiguration of how patients will access services in the county .

documents.title: thanks for joining us !
text: that 's all from the bbc live special from bournemouth and poole hospitals .
you can still get in touch with us using our dorset facebook page , via our @ twitterid twitter account and # solentnhslive .

documents.title: meet the staff : 'every day is different '
text: mark has been a porter at @ twitterid for 15 years .
his alarm went off at 4:30am this morning .
every day is different , '' he says .
you just rise to the challenge , even if your feet are hanging off at the end of the day ! ''
# solentnhslive

documents.title: meet the patients : 'i would n't be here today if it was n't for the staff '
text: david underhill , 66 , had a heart attack in october .
his wife called an ambulance and paramedics rushed him to bournemouth hospital.within 10 minutes of arriving he was on the operating table being fitted with stents .
`` thanks to the emergency medical staff i am standing here today , '' he said .

documents.title: meet the patients : 'i 'm in good hands '
text: richard deven , 59 , from ferndown , was diagnosed with prostate cancer three months ago .
he 's about to have his first operation at bournemouth hospital .
he said he 's feeling apprehensive but feels he 's in good hands .
he 's hoping for a speedy recovery - like his racing slippers .

documents.title: meet the staff : poole hospital maternity unit receptionist 'delivered baby in car '
text: poole hospital maternity unit receptionist dale austin has kept an emergency `` birthing box '' under her desk ever since she had to help deliver a baby in a car on the road outside the hospital .
the box contains towels , blankets and scissors to cut the umbilical cord .

documents.title: hospitals shake-up 'about improving patient care '
text: poole hospital 's ceo , debbie fleming , has no doubts about her feelings regarding dorset ccg 's plans not to make her hospital the emergency centre .
she recognises it 's about significant change but firmly believes it 's about improving things for patients .

debbie fleming said it was always agreed between the hospitals that - whatever the final decision - it would be supported because `` we are all in this together and we want to get on with improving things '' .
`` it is really important we all stop debating and arguing about it , and get on with the changes that we know need implementing , '' she added .

documents.title: meet the patients : 'complete confidence in staff '
text: darren nichols , 49 , was diagnosed type of blood cancer in 2016 after suffering with stomach pain .
after undergoing a series of tests he started treatment a month later .
today is part of his last series of chemotherapy treatments at royal bournemouth .
a machine removes his blood and stem cells .
the stem cells are kept and put back in his body following a final round of intense chemo .
the married father-of-two said : `` we 're very fortunate to live here where i can get treated so well , close to home .
`` i do n't feel like i 've suffered really .
it hits you like a truck when you 're diagnosed but i have complete confidence in the staff . ''

documents.title: poole hospital 'full up '
text: poole hospital is currently `` full up '' , its emergency planning officer has said .
libby beesley said : `` we 've got no oncology beds , we have very little capacity in critical care - so we 've got one in , one out - so that 's a major concern this morning .
she said there were `` a few '' beds in the emergency assessment unit , adding : `` otherwise we are full up . ''
in total the hospital is dealing with 25 cases of flu .
she said the shortage of beds was `` quite usual '' during the winter months .

documents.title: dorset healthcare changes : hospital bed losses in favour of community beds
text: the changes are aimed at avoiding a projected funding shortfall of £ 158m by 2021 .
dorset clinical commissioning group ( ccg ) said it wants 110,000 patients a year to be treated closer to home .
bournemouth will become the main emergency hospital , with poole becoming a centre for planned treatment and operations .
poole hospital will lose its a & e , maternity and paediatric services to bournemouth - but will have an 24/7 urgent care centre .
poole will specialise in planned operations , with 45,000 routine operations moving from bournemouth to poole annually .
poole hospital will lose 407 beds - two thirds of its current beds - and 654 acute beds .
an extra 69 community beds will be created but westhaven hospital in weymouth and st leonard 's near ringwood will close .
portland and wareham hospitals could also close along with westminster memorial hospital in shaftesbury .
patients will instead use `` community care hubs '' for appointments and outpatient clinics .
the ccg said dorset county hospital will keep its a & e but should find ways to share its paediatric and maternity departments with yeovil district hospital in somerset .

changes to mental health acute care include the closure and relocation of beds at the linden unit in weymouth and the creation of extra inpatient beds at st ann 's hospital in poole and forston clinic near dorchester .

documents.title: meet the staff : sos beds 'used often ' at royal bournemouth but staff 'pulling together '
text: wendy sewell , 59 , is a deputy sister and in charge of ward 18 , where she has worked for 16 years .
it 's a surgical admissions unit for patients either referred by a & e or their gp for things like appendicitis , vascular problems , gall stones and bladder infections .
the ward has 15 patient beds and six for use in an emergency .
this winter , those sos beds have been used often .
ms sewell said it has been the busiest winter she can remember .
we 've been so busy but the staff are terrific at pulling together and making sure patients are cared for .
there are so many people here who make this hospital run smoothly , frontline and backroom staff - all are so important .

documents.title: poole and royal bournemouth hospitals merger 'could happen next april '
text: merging poole and royal bournemouth could happen `` as early as april 2019 '' , poole hospital 's ceo debbie fleming has said .
bournemouth will become the main emergency hospital , with poole becoming a centre for planned treatment and operations .
the plans were approved by dorset clinical commissioning group ( ccg ) approved the changes in october .

documents.title: helloooooo baaaaaby !
text: poole hospital 's maternity unit has already welcomed four babies into the world since midnight .

documents.title: ccg responds to concerns over dorset hospitals shake-up
text: simon watkins is a gp at a poole surgery , and also the clinical care lead at dorset 's clinical commissioning group which decides how healthcare in dorset is delivered .
he has responded to concerns from people opposed to the forthcoming changes across dorset healthcare - in particular , travel times to hospitals for those facing a medical emergency .

under the plans , poole hospital will lose its a & e , maternity and paediatric services to bournemouth , which will become the main emergency hospital , with poole becoming a centre for planned treatment and operations .
the ccg also agreed dorset county hospital should find ways to share its paediatric and maternity departments with yeovil district hospital in somerset .

changes to mental health acute care include the closure and relocation of beds at the linden unit in weymouth and the creation of extra inpatient beds at st ann 's hospital in poole and forston clinic near dorchester .
what we are looking to do is to improve the quality of care at the end of that journey .

we hear a lot about the 'golden hour ' - the first hour after a traumatic injury , when emergency treatment is most likely to be successful - but the vast majority of emergency admissions do not require treatment within that golden hour , so they are not time-decisive .

documents.title: bournemouth hospital responds over nhs winter pressures
text: as part of detailed annual winter plan we had already reduced our non-urgent elective procedures until 15 january to avoid the very busy winter period .
we will continue to review this situation daily .
we also have no current plans to put our patients in mixed sex wards .
the situation remains at escalated levels , and we are grateful for our staff , partners , volunteers and carers for all they are doing .
our emergency department remains incredibly busy and so we encourage you to call nhs 111 and seek advice if you are unsure where to get treatment .

documents.title: 'under-funding to blame for winter pressures ' - campaigner
text: damien stone , founder of the campaign group keep our nhs public dorset , said : `` there 's record under-funding of the nhs and year-on-year it 's going to lead to the shortage of things like ambulances and staff , and that 's why you see these pressures at wintertime when people are getting the flu . ''

plans have now been approved to close poole hospital 's a & e with maternity and paediatric services moving to bournemouth , which will become the main emergency hospital , with poole becoming a centre for planned treatment and operations .
however , mr stone said the shake-up would lead to a shortage of beds in the county .
`` this is no way to deal with what is this on-going crisis , '' he added .

documents.title: more than 200 a & e patients per day at poole hospital
text: it 's been a quiet morning , so far , at poole hospital 's emergency department .
this is where the ambulances arrive .
just one has done so this morning but staff say it 's not usual to have nine or 10 waiting at a time .
the emergency department sees about 220 patients a day .

documents.title: meet the staff : 'we 're all in this together '
text: sue davies , 50 , is a surgical matron at royal bournemouth hospital and has been at the hospital for 24 years .

she aims to ensure patients are getting the care they need and that staff maintain high standards.she said the hospital is getting busier every year with more patients arriving with more complex needs .
`` we 're all in this together .
we are busy but our teams are well supported and we work hard . ''

documents.title: a room with a view
text: patients on poole hospital 's avonbourne ward - an acute medical ward specialising in general medical and elderly care - woke up to this view this morning

documents.title: meet the staff : bournemouth hospital 's 'little vampires '
text: their colleagues call them `` the little vampires '' .
they 're the blood bank team who visit wards , take blood and return samples safely to the lab .
say hello to sue berry , patricia stachniuk , carol williams and nicky keynes .

documents.title: winter pressures : 'small amount ' of appointments rearranged at poole hospital
text: about 20 appointments were rescheduled last week at poole hospital .
mark mould , chief operating officer at the hospital , described it as a `` small amount '' .
`` the decision to rearrange some medical investigations unit appointments predates guidance released on tuesday by nhs england , '' he said .
he added : `` cancer operations and other urgent procedures and appointments are unaffected . ''

documents.title: poole hospital 'stretched '
text: poole hospital 's medical director admits the service is particularly stretched .
angus wood said because of the type of hospital poole is it 's currently under worse pressure than most , with a high proportion of its work being emergencies .
this means there is very little elective work it can postpone to provide any `` wriggle room '' .

documents.title: third time lucky for knee op patient
text: it 's third time lucky for 82-year-old terry strange from new milton .

he 's at royal bournemouth hospital today for a knee replacement after having the operation cancelled twice at the end of last year.he expects to be in for three days so said he had packed a nice dressing gown in his overnight bag .
he said the hospital does ok '' , but added he was concerned about the future availability of eastern european nursing staff at the hospital after brexit .

documents.title: 'step change ' in increase in demand during winter
text: poole hospital has seen an increase in demand year-round , but there 's always a `` step change '' during the winter , chief operating officer mark mould has said .
there is always planning for the expected winter pressures - not in isolation , but in collaboration with other health agencies , he said .
`` up to the end of december , our level of delays has been significantly reduced , '' he added .

documents.title: 'busiest christmas and new year yet ' at bournemouth hospital
text: this christmas and new year has been the busiest royal bournemouth hospital has dealt with in terms of a & e , its chief executive tony spotswood has said .
he said there had been an increase in people arriving at a & e and admission levels .
dorset clinical commissioning group ( ccg ) is proposing changes which would see poole hospital become a centre for planned operations .
the ccg said ths would mean it would be less affected by increasing winter demand .

documents.title: ambulance service calls 'up by 12,000 across dorset ' over christmas period
text: the festive season saw a big increase in the number of calls to the ambulance service - up 12,000 across dorset alone during the past four weeks , according to simon trenchard , operation officer at bournemouth ambulance station .
he added it was made worse by christmas day and boxing day falling immediately after a weekend , meaning gp surgeries were closed for four days .
the busiest day for the ambulance station was new year 's day with double the usual number of calls .

documents.title: listen : what happens inside a 24/7 emergency hospital ?
text: neil sackley meets the staff who keep royal bournemouth hospital running 24/7

documents.title: 'more in-patient mental health beds needed '
text: rachel small , mental health community services manage for dorset healthcare , said a review of mental health services in the county found more in-patient mental health beds were needed .
she added : `` we also need to change our communities services to improve the access people have to them , especially at evenings and weekends . ''

in order to do this , she added : `` it 's about looking at the resources we have and questioning whether we use them in the best way possible , or how can we use them to better meet the needs of what people are telling us they want .

`` it 's about looking at changing where the beds are in dorset - so moving some around to be closer to where people are and where they live , so less travel time - and increasing the number that we have and also changing the community support that we offer . ''
she added the services would be more `` community focused '' .

documents.title: royal bournemouth hospital stats
text: the royal bournemouth hospital ( rbh ) is an acute hospital which opened in 1992 .
it currently has a 24-hour emergency department and a surgery admissions unit - the sandbourne suite .
a purpose built ophthalmic unit is located on site , as well as a cardiology unit - the dorset heart centre and orthopaedic service providing hip and knee replacements - the derwent unit .
rbh also provides district-wide services for cardiac interventions , vascular surgery and urology .
outpatient clinics are provided for oral surgery , paediatrics , plastic surgery and ear , nose and throat ( ent ) .
between april 2016 and march last year , rbh saw :
it also employed 4,411 members of staff , both clinical and non-clinical .
the hospital saw an increase in urgent care admissions of 8.3 % which mirrors the pressures faced by trusts across the country , particularly over the winter .

documents.title: cancelled hospital appointments 'will be thing of past '
text: poole hospital losing its a & e and becoming a centre for planned treatment and operation would mean cancelling appointments during busy periods would become `` a thing of the past '' , the head of urgent clinical care for dorset clinical commissioning group ( ccg ) has said .
dr simon watkins , who is also a gp at evergreen oak surgery in poole , said : it 's the urgents [ patients ] that are taking up the beds , meaning the routines are being cancelled . ''

documents.title: poole hospital stats
text: poole hospital nhs foundation trust is an acute general hospital .
it currently has a 24-hour major accident and emergency department and is the designated trauma unit for east dorset , serving a population of more than 500,000 people .

the trust provides general hospital services to residents in poole , purbeck and east dorset as well as a range of additional services such as maternity and neonatal care , paediatrics , oral surgery and neurology , including to bournemouth and christchurch residents .
the hospital 's dorset cancer centre provides medical and clinical oncology services for the whole of dorset , serving more than 750,000 residents .
between 2016 and 2017 , the hospital saw :

documents.title: 'worst ever winter ' for nhs hospitals
text: poole hospital matron geoff walker has said this is the `` toughest '' winter he has seen in 32 years of nursing .
he added the current pressures of the winter period `` impact greatly '' on his role and his staff who are are working in `` very difficult and strenuous circumstances '' .
i would say that in 32 years of nursing this is probably the toughest i 've seen it at the beginning of a year .

the major issues i have at the moment are not only that my patients have to be seen in a timely fashion , within the emergency department , but also on the general wards where we are looking after those patients who need follow-up care to make sure that packages of care and discharge are available .
but most importantly to support my staff who are delivering that care in very , very difficult and strenuous circumstances .
to give you an example we have had to open additional beds to meet that demand - at this time in general medicine we have about 24 to 26 extra beds open , which requires [ extra ] staffing .

documents.title: wakey wakey , eggs and bakey
text: on a ty morning at poole hospital 's dolphin restaurant 160 rashers of bacon and 150 eggs will be consumed by outpatients and visitors .

documents.title: meet the staff
text: dr sadia sumreen , one of the out of hours gps at @ twitterid after a busy evening # solentnhslive
sarah lee is one of a small team who keep @ twitterid running 24 hours a day .
everything from emergency admissions to phones not working are dealt with in here # solentnhslive
alex harris is one of a team of porters that cover @ twitterid 24 hours a day 7 days a week # solentnhslive
some of the staff keeping @ twitterid going through the night .
hear more as we go live at 0630 # solentnhslive

documents.title: recap : attempt to review hospital shake-up failed
text: the changes to reorganise dorset nhs hospital services were met with opposition from campaigners .
they held several protests and called for the shake-up decision to be reviewed by the government .
the county council 's health and scrutiny committee also said it had concerns about the loss of beds and services , and recommended a review .
however , the attempt failed in december when the authority 's joint committee said it would not be referred to the secretary of state for health .

documents.title: recap : dorset nhs hospitals shake-up plans
text: dorset clinical commissioning group ( ccg ) agreed changes to dorset nhs hospital services in october .

under the plans , poole hospital ( will lose its a & e , maternity and paediatric services to bournemouth , which will become the main emergency hospital , with poole becoming a centre for planned treatment and operations .
the ccg also agreed dorset county hospital should find ways to share its paediatric and maternity departments with yeovil district hospital in somerset .

changes to mental health acute care include the closure and relocation of beds at the linden unit in weymouth and the creation of extra inpatient beds at st ann 's hospital in poole and forston clinic near dorchester .

documents.title: good morning !
text: welcome to a special bbc live service this morning .
with the nhs in the thick of winter pressures we 're spending the morning at poole and royal bournemouth hospitals , with reports and stories from across the dorset healthcare service .
we will also be looking at an agreed shake-up of the service and exploring how it works now and to how it will operate after the reconfiguration of hospitals .
you can get in touch with us using ourdorsetfacebook page , via our @ bbcdorsettwitter account and # solentnhslive .
